snippet: CAN society afford to eliminate crime?         No, on two counts, says Mark A. Cohen, an economics professor at Vanderbilt University's Owen Graduate School of Management. "Society cannot afford a zero crime rate," he said. "We would bankrupt ours...
lead_paragraph: CAN society afford to eliminate crime? No, on two counts, says Mark A. Cohen, an economics professor at Vanderbilt University's Owen Graduate School of Management. "Society cannot afford a zero crime rate," he said. "We would bankrupt ourselves, and we'd also have a society we wouldn't like." The society created, he said, would resemble the old Soviet Union.

headline.main: Ideas & Trends;Prison: Where the Money Is
